Mike Pence Paul Ryan , a leading conservative voice on fiscal matters, acknowledged that the Barack Obama entered office facing a difficult economic situation, but he contended that his policies have only exacerbated the problem. The facts are clear: Since taking office, Barack Obama has signed into law spending increases of nearly 25 percent for domestic government agencies-- an 84 percent increase when you include the failed stimulus. All of this new government spending was sold as` investment.' Yet after two years, the unemployment rate remains above 9 percent and government has added over$ 3 trillion to our debt, said Mike Pence Paul Ryan . Much like the Barack Obama 's address, Mike Pence Paul Ryan 's speech was more focused on vision than policy specifics. Still, the differences were clear.
